identificationModule.briefTitle: Prismatic Lenses and tDCS in Neglect
identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effect of Prismatic Lenses in Association With tDCS in Patients With Neglect: a Pilot Study

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The goal of this study is to to evaluate the effect and feasibility of a rehabilitation protocol with prismatic lenses associated with tDCS, compared to a prismatic lens rehabilitation protocol associated with sham stimulation, in reducing the signs of neglect in a group of patients with spatial heminegligence following ischemic stroke of the right hemisphere.

The secondary objective is to evaluate the impact of this rehabilitation protocol on functional outcome.

armGroups.label: Experimental
armGroups.description: Patients will receive anodic tEs combined with prismatic lenses for two weeks
interventionNames: Combination Product: Prismatic adaptation and electric stimulation

armGroups.label: Control
armGroups.description: Patients will receive sham tEs combined with prismatic lenses for two weeks
interventionNames: Combination Product: Prismatic adaptation and electric stimulation

interventions.name: Prismatic adaptation and electric stimulation
interventions.description: Combinatory effect of tEs and prismatic lenses in the experimental group and of sham stimulation and prismatic lenses in control group

primaryOutcomes.description: Oxford Cognitive Screening (OCS): is structured in 10 subtests: picture naming (0-4); semantics (0-3); orientation (0-4); visual field (0-4); sentence reading (0-15); number writing (0-3); calculation (0-4); broken hearts (0-50); praxis (0-12); recall and recognition (0-4); trails task (0-13)
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline OCS at 2 weeks

primaryOutcomes.description: The semi structured scale for the functional evaluation of extrapersonal neglect (0-9); high score means a worse outcome
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change form baseline the semi structured scale for the functional evaluation of extrapersonal neglect at 2 weeks

primaryOutcomes.description: The semi structured scale for the functional evaluation of personal neglect (0-9); high score means worse outcome
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change form baseline the semi structured scale for the functional evaluation of personal neglect at 2 weeks

primaryOutcomes.description: Bergegò Scale (0-30); high score means a better outcome
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline the Bergegò Scale at 2 weeks.

primaryOutcomes.description: Barthel Index (0-100); high score means a better outcome
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Change from baseline the Barthel Index at 2 weeks

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* age \>18 years
* ischemic stroke
* hospitalization within 90 days of the event

Exclusion Criteria:

* heamorrhagic stroke
* history of neurological disease
* history of psychiatric disease
* use of alchool and drugs
